poem:
"Glyndebourne Stage"

On the magisterial stage,
each hinged detail a delight,
Danilo slides in tipsy rage,
a play of shadows in the night.

A staircase brimmed in golden hue,
every inch with tales did bloom.
The Merry Widow's vibrant crew,
bestir the still, hushed auditorium.

In the intoxication of movement,
and the orchestra's mellifluous tune,
we lose ourselves in fleeting moments,
under the chortle of the moon.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
